alert.note: Alert for Grant; Jefferson; Lonoke; Pulaski (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 21 at 9:22AM CDT until July 21 at 9:45AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 AM CDT FOR WEST CENTRAL LONOKE...NORTHEASTERN GRANT...NORTHWESTERN JEFFERSON...SOUTHEASTERN SALINE AND SOUTHEASTERN PULASKI COUNTIES... At 921 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Sweet Home to Wrightsville to near Orion to near Cane Creek, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Little Rock... North Little Rock... Wrightsville... Redfield... Cane Creek... Ironton... Estes... Toltec Mounds State Park... East End... Orion... Sweet Home... Scott... Bauxite... Baucum... Higgins... College Station... Vimy Ridge... Woodson... Parkers-Iron Springs... Hensley... HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Little Rock. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
